intro: Castalia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican castalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Castalia mexicana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions make it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
